newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian anglers adrift on Baltic ice.
newsitem.headline: Russian anglers adrift on Baltic ice.

text.p: Fourteen Russian anglers were left adrift in the Gulf of Finland on Tuesday night when the ice from which they were fishing broke away, Interfax news agency said.
It quoted Emergencies Ministry officials saying the floe was 600 metres (yards) from the coast of the Gulf, a offshoot of the Baltic Sea west of the Russian port city of St. Petersburg.

Fishing from the edge of the ice-pace or through holes cut in the surface is a popular winter pastime for Russians, often fortified with copious helpings of vodka. Anglers are often set adrift and a good number drown in this way every year.
